result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Status conference on January 12, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on March 7, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on March 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 10:09am 
Defendant Jeffery S. Van Beem in court with Attorney Emily Bell. DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Bell indicates the Defense filed a supplement demand for discovery for documents related to the blood testing. The Defense has received the requested documents, but still needs to go over the materials.  The Defense is waiting for records from EMT's who treated Mr. Van Beem the subject night. 
DA Hall requests the scheduling of trial dates; a two day trial length is estimated.
The Court indicates that there will be a likely assignment of new judge after January 1st, directing Attorney Bell to go over the related rights with the Defendant.
recess 10:13am

NEXT:  (1) Status Conference on January 12th at 10:00am,  (2) FSSC on March 7th at 9:30am (3) Jury Trial on March 13th and 14th at 8:30am

[ml] Case called at 9:37AM
Defendant Jeffery S. Van Beem in court with attorney Andrew Walter. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This file is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing, however the Defense files waiver paperwork prior to the case being called. The Court proceeds with a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:

Mr. Van Beem waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

The Defense declines to proceed to Arraignment today and requests that it be scheduled for another date and time. The State advises that it is requesting that the Arraignment be postponed as well.
The Court instructs the State to file an Amended Information within 30 days.

Att Walter advises that both parties are requesting that the Refusal Hearing be continued to another date and time. The State advises that this is correct.

recess  9:42AM

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 04/06 at 8:30AM   (2) Status Conference on 05/02 at 8:30AM

Refusal hearing on March 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ec: DA and Atty Walter

It is my understanding that the parties wish for a stand alone preliminary hearing, apart from the block calendar. I already filled my 2/25 calendar this morning, so parties will have to arrange for another time. 3/4 or 3/8 is currently open.

Surety Information

Request for Refusal Hearing

[ma] Case called at 3:07pm [All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Jeffery S. Van Beem appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. Attorney Andrew Walter appears.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty Flint verifies victim rights compliance.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $7500 CASH Bond with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no contact with Witness 1
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 3:17  pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 2/4/22 at 8:30am
